title: FS: T215 Red Cross Type 1 Reulbach (SOLD)
author: edjs

posts.post_title: FS: T215 Red Cross Type 1 Reulbach (SOLD)
posts.post_content: Selling my T215 Red Cross Type 1 Reulbach, No Glove Showing.  The only example I can find graded between PSA and SGC (edited to update: Steve let me know there is an SGC grade example, I did not see it when I checked, I only saw the type 2).  If you are actually trying to complete this set, you need this card.  I'm asking [STRIKE]$1500[/STRIKE] SOLDand for full transparency, I could think this card may go higher (or lower, for that matter).  It is hard to set the market on a population [STRIKE]1[/STRIKE] 2 card, so with that said, I will entertain offers before I sell, so being the first to say you will take it may not get you the card.  I will consider all offers and accept the best.  I understand that I may be off base with my asking price, so feel free to make your best offer, all offers will be considered.  Price is net to me,  though I will cover domestic shipping and insurance (I will work with  you if international).  PayPal only on this, please.  E-mail me with  your questions or offers, [URL="skeltone@rocketmail.com"]skeltone@rocketmail.com[/URL].  Thanks.
I have been told of an SGC graded example, I may have not seen it when I checked the pop report.  I will still look for the best offer on this, still a very rare card.

Hi Ed, the SGC report is just a random list that is not in alphabetical order, so it is easy to miss something.

SGC shows 1 Type I Reulbach card, which is an SGC 10.
PSA only shows your card.

For Type II's, SGC has 1 Ruelbach and PSA doesn't have any listed.

Yours is a beauty for an SGC10 and it is extremely rare.

Good luck with your sale!  Rick
Thanks, Rick.  I did not want anyone to think I was being deceptive when I thought it was the only graded example.  I have no issue being wrong, and I am as honest about a card as I can be.
nice card...I think your price is fair...a proverbial hens tooth!

[quote name="ullmandds" post=1817189]nice card...I think your price is fair...a proverbial hens tooth![/QUOTE]

Thanks Pete, and the card is sold.  Thanks to everyone for their offers and advice.
